entry.et: Middle English, from Anglo-French or Late Latin; Anglo-French criminal, from Late Latin criminalis, from Latin crimin-, crimen crime

def.dt: :relating to, involving, or being a crime criminal neglect
:relating to crime or to the prosecution of suspects in a crime criminal statistics brought criminal action
:of or befitting a criminal a criminal mind
:a person who has been convicted of a crime
:a court that has jurisdiction to try and punish offenders against criminal law
:the law of crimes and their punishments
:a lawyer who specializes in criminal law
:a lawyer who represents defendants in criminal cases
:a crime (as genocide or maltreatment of prisoners) committed during or in connection with war usually used in plural
